Really really fun game and I play it with my friends and I enjoy all the cool events. Its fun to collect all the brawlers and level them up with their unique powers. Bugs get constantly fixed, however internet lagging is common. Aside from that, overall gameplay and quality is awesome.

The matchmaking is so bad, you literally never get to play with your trophy level. I think it's the core of why randoms are bad in the first place. High player get paired with players <10k trophies and lose. It's also why so many 50k+ players are worse now than then, their opponents are also in the same situation. Meaning the whole lobby is bad, just the worst losses. Idk why you guys made it like this, and for the longest time you never change it.
do something about your matchmaking im so tired of getting into games with people being AFK or ill do 100k+ and they won't break 10k. give me a break.

I'm nearing 85000 trophies and I'm getting placed in championship games where my teammates started playing maybe a few days ago and only have a few thousand trophies. It's a game that's become solely for playing with your friends but as friends stop playing and you're one of the few who still play, it's hardly fun to play with randoms unlike in the past.

The game is fun, with good mechanics and a lot of team strategy. However, it is pay to play/win. Universal characters can be unlocked, but in order to have them at a competitive level, you'll need to spend money to level them and get their gear. You can spend $1000+ on the game and have less than 20 percent of the characters unlocked, leveled, and with their gear. If you plan to play the game long term, you will be spending long term with new character releases and gear.

Don't even waste your time. The game has gone way downhill. It's almost unplayable unless you're in a full team. You play any character over 100 trophies, and you play against power 11s. You play as someone power 11, you're against a full party of 11s with a team of 7s and 8s. I've put 3 years into this game, and it hasn't always been this way. Matchmaking used to be based on mainly trophies and then level. You played a power 9. You only played against 8s, 9s, and 10s. Good job, Supercell.

Brawl Stars shifted from RNG boxes to even more RNG with Stardrops, despite aiming for less randomness. They removed guaranteed rewards (for example, Mastery), where it was guaranteed that you would get coins (for upgrades) and credits (for unlocking brawlers). The new "Records" system now gives Stardrops, meaning less predictable progression and fewer reliable resources for character development, which is ironic.

Mastery rework killed the game. Not enough people were earning cosmetic titles, so they scrapped the mastery system altogether. Before, you could grind a specific brawler and earn thousands of gold, hundreds of power points and hundreds of unlock credits. Now, you grind 50 wins on a brawler and you get 2 star drops then nothing but useless cosmetics (not even skins). So it takes 10x longer to unlock each character and 100x longer upgrade, but at least everyone has a neat profile picture right?

GREAT GAME This is obviously an online game so there are no ads but there are in-game purchases. This game is brawler specific skill based so if you have a rank 15 brawler you would go against other people with the same ranked brawler. But if you then play a lower ranked brawler like at rank 5 you would then go against fellow rank 5s. There are many in game events and monthly updates giving each month a new season and feel. I love this game it's extremely well taken care of, supercell is great.
